burlap.shell.visual

Class SGVisualExplorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • burlap.shell.visual.SGVisualExplorer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorldObserver, ShellObserver, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants

    public class SGVisualExplorer
extends JFrame
implements ShellObserver, WorldObserver
    This class allows you act as all of the agents in a stochastic game (controlled by a World object) by choosing actions for each of them to take in specific states. A game with registered agents in the world can also be played out (with some or all of the agents being manually controlled). States are conveyed to the user through a 2D visualization and the user specifies actions for each agent by pressing keys that are mapped to actions or by typing the actions into the action command field. After each action is specified, the corresponding joint action is taken by pressing a special finalizing key that by default is set to "c". The ` key causes the state to reset to the initial state provided to the explorer or the World's StateGenerator. This explorer also associates itself with a SGWorldShell so that additional commands can be given. Keys can also be mapped to execute specific shell commands. You can access the shell with the

    Author:
    James MacGlashan

      • addKeyAction

        public void addKeyAction(String key,
                         int actingAgent,
                         Action action)
        Specifies the action to set for a given key press. Actions should be formatted to include the agent name as follows: "agentName::actionName" This means that different key presses will have to specified for different agents.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that will cause the action to be set
        actingAgent - the id of the acting agent
        action - the action to set when the specified key is pressed.

      • addKeyAction

                         int actingAgent,
                         String actionTypeName,
                         String paramStringRep)
        Adds a key action mapping.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that is pressed by the user
        actingAgent - the acting agent for this command
        actionTypeName - the name of the ActionType
        paramStringRep - the string representation of the action parameters
